website_summaries.verdict: Comes with a variety of features to help you optimize your connection and prioritize your device for gaming.
pros: View real-time bandwidth usage of all devices and prioritize bandwidth for your gaming device
Features a geo filter (black/whitelist servers based on distance) and a gaming VPN
Easy for novices to set up and use
Manage access with Nighthawk App for your mobile device
cons: Some users had problems getting this router up and running
Reports of this router dropping connections frequently

website_summaries.verdict: Netgear and NetDuma teamed up to create a gamer's delight inside a futuristic-looking router. The XR500's speed and range are more than enough for a medium-to-large home. The DumaOS interface has lots of customization options and helpful hints for even novice router users.
pros: Gamers have total control with tons of options to reduce lag, stabilize ping and ensure local connections while playing console games
The menu has helpful pop-up screens to explain what each setting does
The router's range on 2.4GHz was impressive
cons: It would have been nice if geo-filtering worked for more PC games, even though similar features are available through the actual games themselves
Its top speed on 5GHz was a little slower than I've seen with other similar routers and there's no useful app

customer_reviews.title: this is best investment I'v made in my gaming setup
customer_reviews.text: Guys and gals, the xr500 is a monster of a router. Duma OS + Netgear hardware = Pure magic. I can definitely say that next to, or hell equal to the R1, this is best investment I'v made in my gaming setup. Monitor, controllers, and headsets aren't shit if the quality of you connection is lacking. The xr500 simply delivers the best online gaming experience possible. The router is easy to setup and use and the Netduma team are always available should you have any issues. I'd pay $1000 for this router so $300 seems like a sweet deal to me!! Folks, you gotta get one to understand where I'm coming from..
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Get this router!!!
customer_reviews.text: Recently upgraded from the Netduma R1 to this router for gaming. The new dumaOS is incredible and with my gigabit fiber connection and CAT7 cables this is the best setup available for online gaming. The DumaOS is extremely customizable and is very simple to setup and run.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps dropping connection... Upon restarting unit it ...
customer_reviews.text: Keeps dropping connection... Upon restarting unit it automatically does a factory reset, even happened with tech support on the phone. Non stop problems for a month. Returning and going with something different.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Quality Router
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a new router after years of using my old one, namely because I was running into video buffer issues after cord cutting. I was really interested in Netgear and Netduma's partnership with the robust OS features (DumaOS) built for this router when I read about it in January. Needless to say after some time, I'm super impressed with the product itself. Not only were my buffering woes solved, I love the easy to use and customizable dashboard and administration console. Really gives me some cool things to geek out on. On top of all this, my wifi quality has improved, no buffering, and can prioritize traffic to anything I want in my household.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A complete nightmare!
customer_reviews.text: The dashboard is great, the signal is great, the operating system however has HUGE issues, within 4 months, it started malfunctioning, if you set up the recovery where it remembers your settings, it doesn't even work, and everytime it gets reset, like everytime you have a power outage, briefly unplug it or hit the power button, you literally have to set up from the very beginning like you first bought it, I have set this thing up like a dozen times, but something else, you'll regret this purchase It has been a complete nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Kornoelje

customer_reviews.title: wireless does not reach far as it claims
customer_reviews.text: its wireless works only in the closest to the router placement, roughly about 30 feet down the room it looses connection.
customer_reviews.author: Mihir

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY, Netgear scammed me out of warranty
customer_reviews.text: Router all if a sudden stopped working. It just broke after about 1.5 years. I purchased a warranty (which it is still under) and get this: in order to use the warranty i need to first troubleshoot it, but in order to troubleshoot it i have to buy an additional "technical assistance". That's exactly what the Netgear customer service rep told me. You can't use your warranty unless you buy something a different service first. Customer service reps hung up on me, interrupted me, were just horrible people. Worst purchase i ever made. Avoid Netgear at all costs. Don't make the same mistake i did.
customer_reviews.author: Will W.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome router!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old Apple Airport Extreme, wow, what a difference. I am sincerely impressed. The Duma software is great and easy to configure and set up the way you want it to. My Wifi speed has also increased. This has been a great purchase and I would definitely recommend. Update: Still a great router after almost one year of use. Only minor gripe I have is that IPv6 is not working, apparently due to the duma software and they will not provide a fix since not enough users see it as an issue, i guess. Just my 2 cents.
customer_reviews.author: LynxZ

customer_reviews.title: Good Router but the Software needs work.
customer_reviews.text: The nighthawk router has excellent range and I don't have any connectivity issues. It physically looks cool and has a unique configuration page, however so do a lot of other routers that are $200 dollars or less. The setup process wasn't any easier and web configuration page regularly likes to display message boxes stating that a null reference exception or some other type of issue has occurred with one or more of the configuration features. The software seems buggy but when the Router is working it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jt

customer_reviews.title: Good Speeds and Range But Packet Loss Over Ethernet
customer_reviews.text: This router has the DumaOS web interface which is actually very nice. There are a lot of features and things you can customize. But that's where the good ended for me. Unfortunately mine had packet loss and would cut out the internet for a bit then reconnect. Not the kind of reliability you would expect from a $250 router. I had much better luck with an $80 TP-Link. If you search online for the problem you can find others with similar issues. It seems like a lottery if yours will be fine or not. Maybe if Netgear had more communication with the DumaOS developers then there would be more updates to help patch these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Benio

customer_reviews.title: Working pretty well now
customer_reviews.text: Can be somewhat difficult to troubleshoot and adjust in the settings but for the most part it’s pretty easy, might have to reboot after adjusting the settings in DumaOS to see them in effect but overall happy with the router so far! You can see the adjustments you make are actually working and implemented via speed tests and on your video games especially the geo filtering which is pretty cool! It’s sort of difficult to figure out the buffer bloat and how much you should move the slider because the recommended 70% wasn’t working well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Matthaios

customer_reviews.title: Fast wireless internet!  Great control features!
customer_reviews.text: Just upgraded to the recently available gigabyte internet service in my area to finally take advantage of the full capability of this router. The range is easily double what I was getting from the router provided by my cable company. Very easy to set up and the DumaOS control features are easy to use...even for someone not savy with networking. I like being able to see what devices are connected to my network and control which devices have access and how much bandwidth they get.
customer_reviews.author: NancyN186

customer_reviews.title: Beware bad consumer service...
customer_reviews.text: Tech support from netgear is horrible. The 5G wireless radio quit working after 6 months. Netgear has warranty for one year, but only customer support for 30 days. In my case, a mechanical problem occurred after six months. Netgear wanted me to pay $90.00 for a tech to troubleshoot the issue. If the issue was determined to be hardware, they would then refund the &90.00 for tech support. Was on the phone with netgear for 4 hours to get a RMA for my defective unit. Will never buy a consumer netgear product again.
customer_reviews.author: James Andrasek

customer_reviews.title: Beware buy don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: I need back my money it. This is not worth cost $300 tax. That unfair false pro gaming. I remind my old nighthawk ac1900 is not game!!!!!. I never buy that so much again game over. I remember that was 200mbp cannot turn on 1gig cannot help u set up. When I took restore to it work turn on high to 1gig. Srry I never buy netgear again. False Feature doesn't help to me do how I to fix? For nothing it. There no 802.11ax u never got pay for it. Worth netgear $120 it. I need trade him.
customer_reviews.author: ELEMENTELITE

customer_reviews.title: Waning excitement
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to see a router that was dedicated to gaming that had support for PS4 and XBox in addition to PC. The price is more than a traditional router with similar capabilities but without DumaOS. Having the router since its release, the number of firmware updates and OS enhancements has decreased big time. The Nighthawk app does not allow me to disable internet to a single device as I was able to with my previous Netgear router. The router's web interface on my phone is awful and does not scale/function properly - something I hope they fix soon. Overall, the speed and performance of the router outweigh the few negatives I have to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: GooniesNeverSayDie

customer_reviews.title: Did not connect to internet out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I had an older nighthawk router that may or may not have been slowly dying. I decided to replace it with the new xr300. However, the router could or would not connect to my modem to achieve internet access. I tried my modem by itself, and plugged in the older nighthawk router. Both provided internet access to my devices.
customer_reviews.author: Dr d

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi router, terrible support
customer_reviews.text: Love this device, great WiFi coverage and strength. DumoOS could use more functionality, but for what it currently does is far far superior to all the other router software out there. Finally able to see what is happening on my network/router. Found it easy to setup and get working. Now the two bad things I ran into. 1) Get a sharing violation when writing to a USB readyshare volume with Excel .xlsx . Have tried several times with DumoOS support and Netgear community, nobody knows. 2) Netgear support wants me to get a support contract before they will help!?! They have a bug and I have to pay them before they are interested, shame on Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: The Lambo Aventador of routers
customer_reviews.text: Thing router, repeater, AP is the Lamborghini Aventador of all routers. It even looks like an Aventador! Easy to understand interface on the app and login to the router. Read the comments to get some tips to get more out of the device if you like gaming or streaming movies constantly via 4k devices. This router blasts through walls that other routers I had couldn't. That provides a solid signal with good rssi. Plus I love the Smart Connect which meshes the 2.4ghz and 5ghz to give your smaller devices more consistency with Wi-Fi connection. Tip: You'll want rssi low but between 50-99.
customer_reviews.author: DubbleOrNuthin

customer_reviews.title: Buyer BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: Please don't buy this used. The registration that you need it is already taken and Amazon will not do anything about it meaning the router you bought is plug and go.
customer_reviews.author: Ryden

customer_reviews.title: Tired of lag? Look no further!
customer_reviews.text: So I recently got AT&T 1000mb fiber internet. Like most people i was ready for fast internet and lag free gaming. To my dismay, AT&T's supplied gateway is not meant for gaming. I was constantly lagging, and I was tempted to ask for a refund. That's when I came across this router and decided to give it a try. After setting this up behind AT&Ts gateway. The difference was immediately noticable. Little to no lag, lower latency, and better wifi coverage in my home. The best part is the DumaOS you use to control your WiFi allows you to set which devices on your internet have a higher priority. Overall the investment was worth it, and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Unimpressed!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router to replace a Cisco EA6500. I must tell you all I am not impressed with this unit or it’s features. It has the most useless archaic GUI I have seen. Even the old Linksys WRT-54GS from way back, at least had highly alterable perimeters and QOS Prioritizing. For the money this White and Amber indicator light having Black Brick with 4 Antennas is Extremely Unimpressive. Put your hard earned Money into a Quality Ubiquiti Router, I promise you will not be disappointed. .... And No I do not work for Ubiquiti!
customer_reviews.author: Gonzo

customer_reviews.title: Setup was not easy
customer_reviews.text: This is sold as "just plug it in and it works automatically." I'm pretty tech savvy, but it took me about 45 minutes to get it working. I honestly do not know what I did on the 8th try of setting it up, turning both the router and modem on and off - but it finally started to work. Seems solid and fast now that it works. There is a little 1-page installation document without a phone number for tech support. It gives a web site, but that's useless when you do not have a working router (and thus no internet access).
customer_reviews.author: Muy Man

customer_reviews.title: Not just for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: This works great when you have a ton of wifi connected devices. I would suggest any one with a family try this. The fact that you can set what devices get what priority and what bandwidth means you can game and every one can stream. This doesn't prevent lag. But if you deal with lag from the house hold 100percent this can literally take it down to half and down to 30percent utilitizing it. One recommendation is that your house hold should have a 10mbps per person average for this to work great. In other words. If your internet connection is less then 50 Mbps download you won't see a difference with this.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Initally, this was a good device
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it's rock solid. But due for the lack of firmware updates for over a year now and the current disconnection issues, I would have to recommend to steer clear from the Netduma line up. We were told 3.0 is on the way, but have yet to see anything as of yet. After countless factory resets, firmware resets, etc. It's not worth the headache Get a edge router and a dummy access point, it will be a better experience then this.
customer_reviews.author: Your Name

customer_reviews.title: Finally got the internet speed I pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this router to improve my internet speed and was not disappointed. For reference, I placed the router downstairs in a 2500sqft 2-story home. Performance deteriorated at the farthest reaches of the upstairs (as expected) but still remained at acceptable throughput (15 Mbs). Downstairs, the limiting factor for speed was the modem/level of service (100 Mbs Comcast service). The XR300 consistently equalled wired connections (100Mbs) throughout the downstairs of the house. Setup was straightforward. The user interface is similar to other Net Gear routers which allows for various logs, access and content restrictions, or other networking (bridging, etc). Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MM650

customer_reviews.title: Fast router. Very expensive. No parental controls.
customer_reviews.text: This router is fast. For the price, I was hoping to get parental controls with it. There are none. The only thing you can do is block or unblock devices. I can't set time limits unless everything has a static IP. I should have spent more time looking for exactly what I needed instead of buying the high end gaming product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Infrequent Firmware Update
customer_reviews.text: The adds all say "frequent firmware updates" where new features will be added. Reality, infrequent firmware updates. I have only seem them remove a feature (SpeedTest used to be built in, now it just pops up a window to be run on the client and not on the Router itself). I am pessimistic they will add even a single feature in the next few years.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Best gaming router available, easy setup and fine tuning, DumaOS has the best support staff at the Netduma Forums
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a must own for any gamer, pro or casual! I previously owned both a Netduma R1 and a Netgear Nighthawk, to see the two combined is amazing!!! The DumaOS firmware is one of the easiest and most comprehensive softwares I’ve ever used. The support team at Netduma are extremely courteous/quick to assist with any technical issues/inquiries you may have for the router settings and setup. I recommend this router to all gamers trying to get a competitive edge and a consistent great gaming experience! Definitely a buy you’ll never regret!!!
customer_reviews.author: ExtraCrispy86

customer_reviews.title: Very fast
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router because my wi-fi speed was slow & occasionally not happening. I pay for a fast speed from Charter, but wasn't getting it. After talking to their service department, they told me I had a really old router. After researching & reading reviews I purchased this. I plan to return to online gaming when I retire in a couple of months & that requires some speed without interruptions. This router does the job. When I have family over there can be 10 people using the wi-fi. With this router, everyone is happy. :)
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Gunter

customer_reviews.title: Product bricked after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: It was great when it worked but most of the problems appeared several months after purchase. I had to constantly restart the wifi. The wifi is intermittent even when you set it up on channels that are barely being used; devices would also disconnect after several days of use. CONS JUST CONS: - Wifi is intermittent - Interface would lock up so you would be forced to reset - Ethernet wasn't the best either. I'd have to factory reset just to get back into the interface - VPN disconnects after several days - If you have a security system, this isn't reliable - It will eventually become an expensive paper weight
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Better than I hoped for!
customer_reviews.text: First up I must say that it took me a few hours to get everything working properly. Not only did I have to configure this router, I also had to reconfigure my provider's modem/router unit. Hooked up the new router, set the old unit to bridge mode, power reset the old unit, power reset the new router, LAN wired my computer to the new router and programmed the setting as I wanted them. Now I'm pulling higher bandwidth than I'm supposed to get and no more getting kicked off sites or reloading updates because of timeouts. I also like the fact that I can see everything on the network, so I can block anyone not supposed to be there.
customer_reviews.author: J. Loo

customer_reviews.title: Poor tech support
customer_reviews.text: I would rate this router a 5 star but tech support only deserve 1 star.everything work just fine and my internet never get diconnected again after I changed my router to this one.but the first staff of tech support can't even tell me how to use their own product when I use it first time and then he promised me a call back within 20 minute and I received his call back on next day when I already figure it out myself.poor experience with tech support but product is good one.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Best Router Ever
customer_reviews.text: This router absolutely crushed my expectations and put my old router to shame. It was super easy to install and there is so much functionality installed in this router that it is insane. After installing it I immediately noticed a huge improvement from my standard ISP router/modem combo (AT&T). This is by far the best user experience I have ever had with a router as well! If you are even thinking of getting this router, you should take the big leap to get this one. It is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Holland

customer_reviews.title: XR500 totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: Received my XR500 a few days ago up here in Canada. Totally worth every penny. So simple to use and the geofilter matches me to peer servers with 15 ping and 300 miles. Lag has been virtually wiped out. Sometimes I'd get put on a COD WWII dedicated server 8000 miles away. Boy not anymore. Netduma OS with netgear hardware, unstoppable. Super happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Router!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old NETGEAR Nighthawk X6 (R8000) router from 2015 that I left at the house with my ex-wife. This is a simple plug and play hookup and it just looks so awesome from the front! I'm not a big gamer so that part really doesn't do anything for me but with cell phones, computers, Alexa, Google, ring and a whole lot of streaming TV I wanted something that was powerful enough to handle all our needs and this router does all that and then some. Thanks to this new router and a divorce the kids and I have a very strong signal and see things very clearly now!
customer_reviews.author: Adam G

customer_reviews.title: This has to be one of the best routers I have had the pleasure of using
customer_reviews.text: This has to be one of the best routers I have had the pleasure of using. The features allow for easy monitoring and adjusting of network settings while still providing advanced options for the enthusiasts out there. PROS: -Great signal strength across our entire house (2400 sq. ft) -The BEST UI -Easy to use -Tons of features -Advanced network monitoring CONS: -Pricey (although I doubt you will find a better router in this price range)
customer_reviews.author: Niccole Lopiccolo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing speeds and customization
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my Nighthawk X6. I really like the dashboard with Duma. It gives me so much more information than the typical admin privilege the X6 had. Interestingly enough, I am getting almost 100 MB's faster speeds with this than the X6 as well. My house is full of streaming and connected devices. Because of this, I've lost all flickering in my Arlo Camera system, zero lag with my thermostat, all devices connected never lag or even buffer. I paired this with the Nighthawk Gaming Switch and it was well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: James Powers

customer_reviews.title: ... I got this router Friday and it took me like 10min to get it set up
customer_reviews.text: So I got this router Friday and it took me like 10min to get it set up, I replaced me old router that my local intent provider gave us( charter) and we are connected at 100mbs, and let me tell you, the speed of my internet/Wi-Fi in the house is not blazing fast, and now I have awesome signal in my living room, which was crappy before I got this router. And the fact that I can dedicate a Wi-Fi signal to lets say my Xbox or ps4 is awesome. This is pretty pricey for a router but it think its well worth and a great buy, no issues here!
customer_reviews.author: John Wick

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 4 months, now it's stuck in a boot loop. It comes with a one year warranty, but only 90 days of free phone support. After calling support, outside of the 90 days, they want to charge me another $90 to extend the phone support. If they can't get the router working they won't charge me. So, the one year warranty is worthless and I'm stuck with a brick.
customer_reviews.author: Timmy

customer_reviews.title: NIGHTMARE WASTE
customer_reviews.text: So the app for this router is busted on the final setup page - which means after youve gone through an arduous install and pairing with your modem and youve named your network, set a password and set your account security Q's - it craps out at finalization. So despite it saying full connection - there is 0 internet availability because the app wont finalize the router setup. 0/10 RETURN IMMINENT , Do not recommend. No manual included either.
customer_reviews.author: Cyber Carebear

customer_reviews.title: Blazing fast and easy set-up!
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying this new router. Was very easy to set up and start using. The user interface is easy to navigate and intuitive with a lot of features. My only challenge was identifying cause of initial restricted bandwidth of 20 Mb/s with a gigabit connection. Seems the QoS protocols are activated by default on new routers and once I shut it off, I see 500 Mb/s symmetrical in adjacent rooms (the range on the XR500 is awesome)! Definite recommendation from this networking novice who usually knows just enough to be dangerous!!
customer_reviews.author: GRiver

customer_reviews.title: Best router ever.
customer_reviews.text: I had the router that just came with the AT&T modem. It buffered and it dropped the signal and it gave me a headache. It digitized HD movies and even muffled the sound. I have ZERO of these issues with the Nighthawk. It even has a strong enough signal to reach the back of the house without a range extender. Thank you, Netgear, for making my entertainment life that much more entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda Aldridge

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic router
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an older router to this, what I can only call, Lamborghini of a router. It's hard to leave a negative review as of this time, when everything about this product is an improvement over my old one. The OS is easy to use and intuitive, the hardware seems solid, and while it lacks 8 port functionality like other comparable routers, this thing has been working very well overall. My ISP broadcasts 150/10 for my service, and my old router was peaking at 16MB/s. On this router, even though it technically defies speeds, I can cap at 22MB/s. Very pleased, we'll see how it holds up over time!
customer_reviews.author: Bart Rogacewicz

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable, easy setup, good UI
customer_reviews.text: So much better than my Asus AC88 router. Could not get my roommate’s PS4 and MacBook to play nicely with my PC with that device.. constant searching of Asus forums and flipping lots of software switches with no success. I wanted to love that one... this thing just works in comparison. Had to restart it once over three months of usage. I consider that a big win. The case looks and feels much chintzier but the performance is what matters
customer_reviews.author: SforSancho

customer_reviews.title: Best i have owned hands down
customer_reviews.text: The things you can do with this router are by far the best I have dealt with between all the ones I have had. The range is good compared to the Netgear 3700 I had before this one. It did not have antennas. My wife and my self game hard wired and we have like 8 things on wifi. This router allows you to easily program it to support no lag gaming with a constant connection. No more lag spikes or drops between loading in. We love this router, has improved our connection by far. So if a gamer or gamer family this is the router to get hands down..
customer_reviews.author: Creeper&Nugglebuni

customer_reviews.title: Expensive lesson- stick with what works
customer_reviews.text: Out of box started out fine- firmware update seemed to brick the device. Internet went out every couple of minutes and speeds were rocking 20-30 instead of my usual 120+ when I only pay for 100 thru spectrum. Tried to reverse the update even with help from netgear-expensive piece of plastic until they fix that update. Good luck it’s going back- I will continue to ride with the old one. A lot of the great fb were from free for review- I should have paid attention to that more.
customer_reviews.author: HuckabeeandSixth

customer_reviews.title: Don't settle for budget garbage.
customer_reviews.text: I used to think my ISP just sucked until I started testing my speed depending on what distance I was from my router. My previous router was a 30 some dollar budget router. My room is on the far side of the house (1400 sf) with the router roughly off center. The signal was so bad that my phone would start switching to LTE. I finally got so fed up with dealing with that POS signal that I made sure I bought top of the line this time. Take a look at the attached picture of speed tests; the results speak for themselves (Note that my max service is rated to 75 mbps). Never going back to budget trash again.
customer_reviews.author: Shady

customer_reviews.title: Router software is slower than molasses
customer_reviews.text: Their DumaOS router software has loads of unecessary features, including logging, various quality-of-service apps, and router specs. The stuff is absolutely useless. It takes forever to load up the 192.168.xxx.xxx interface. Next time im going to pay less for a "dumb" router that doesnt have all this unecessary crap that slows down the processor
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah M.

customer_reviews.title: Good WiFi, ethernet spotty
customer_reviews.text: Good speed on the WiFi, even at 2.6 Ghz. Ethernet ports periodically stop working for some hours at a time. Waded through at least three levels of tech support, each script-based with minimal technological knowledge. Admin interface bills itself as an "Operating System, and is kind of kludgey and non-intuitive in the interface.
customer_reviews.author: G. Corrigan

customer_reviews.title: Worked great - for a month
customer_reviews.text: I had this router for a couple months. The first month, I thought it was the best thing ever. I called it the "Lag Crusher 9000" in my head. The second month, not so much... Extreme latency constantly, to the point video games were unplayable; 700ping average. Today, I switched back to my old router, and saw improvement. Switching back to this Netgear to confirm it was the root of my problems, yielded the result of it not even establishing a connection to the internet - nor was I able to connect to it's configuration page, even after factory resetting it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Great router, a lot of qos features to play with. It's just like the Netduma but on Netgear' s hardware. A very powerful and fast router. I can play my games online without any lag with a household of electronics going. The geo filter helps you get those lan feeling types of games. Their customer support is pretty awesome. Very responsive and quick to help you.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Brown

customer_reviews.title: Struggled To Get Online
customer_reviews.text: I had read some amazing reviews about this router on Amazon as well as other sites claiming how rock solid this router is. They however did not mention the firmware that they were using during the time of their tests that would have influenced their perception. I had updated my firmware to 2.3.2.40 and I was unable to connect to the internet except with a wired connection and wireless connectivity for all my devices consistently failed. I ended up having to roll back to the previous version in order to get everything to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Skywalker

customer_reviews.title: Did not perform as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Never could get this router to work like it was supposed to. Netgear customer service was no help at all and really weren’t knowledgeable about this item.
customer_reviews.author: Jason & Jackie Procell

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace the 1st one after a month because it quit working. Had to reset the 2nd one twice now. User software has bugs that Netgear actually knows about. When it works it is good but would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slow to no updates...
customer_reviews.text: No firmware updates in over six months. One reason for buying a Duma OS powered router is that it would receive constant updates and pataches, I believe Netgear is dropping the ball on this one and instead supporting it's new AX series of routers. I'm about ready to start looking for my next router, probably not from netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Technophile

customer_reviews.title: So far I am impressed!
customer_reviews.text: So far I am impressed! I went from a low end (in a ball park of $100) LinkSys WiFi router to this one. Had to upgrade. I was forced by the recent malware/worm that was infecting it. Unfortunately when I upgrading the old LinkSys firmware, some of my wifi devices would stop working. Seriously, LinkSys!? So instead of buying another cheap sh*t LinkSys router I decide to go all-out and buy this expensive one. And boy was I right. My connectivity not only visibly improved, it was also a breeze to set up this alien looking router. Very easy to use so far. Can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: does the job and then some
customer_reviews.text: love this thing. I have never felt such power at my finger tips. It's so extremely easy to use and see whats connected. The signal is strong any where I am in the house, 1700 square feet. Over all I am very happy with this product. We are very heavy on our wifi between streaming, playing games and having up to 10 devices running at a time and have never had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. Stay far away from NETGEAR. It was great for less than a year. There is a reason why they provide technical support for 90 days and there after you have to pay for tech support. I bought this in September 2019 and 8 months later the router is not working properly. Just do some research and you will find there is many issues with this model. Latency, the physical antennas, QoS, Geo location, the dual band, and more. If I connect straight to my ISP modem I get 300 down. If I connect to the router I get 65 down and 200+ ping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed, especially with the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great router, there is no doubt but you can very easily get the same or similar quality from routers 100$ to 200$ cheaper. Within the first month of owning the company's proprietary dumaos firmware failed me (I couldnt access the default gateway webpage) and I had to roll back to a previous version (removing security updates, new features, and more). I would later look on the forum and it was a widespread bug which I still don't even know if its fixed. I'm teetering on the edge of giving this a 2 star just thinking about it now.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hutzel

customer_reviews.title: Growing Into My Router
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a Linksys E3000 router since it had been released. The performance of the NightHawk verses my old router is night and day. I am hoping to get a fiber line ran into my apartment soon. This router already makes all of my devices wonderful to communicate with, in home, but it will be even better once the fiber comes into my building. Having two separate SSIDs for 5G and 2.4G makes my life better as well as the QoS distribution settings. I’m still learning all the capabilities of this router but truly enjoy unlocking each mystery.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't stay connected
customer_reviews.text: What else can be said. This POS router couldn't stay connected. It disconnects from the internet twice daily. Only after a hard-reset could the router get connected to the internet. But after a few hours, it drops again, and again... so on and so forth. I only had the router for two days, albeit, I didn't want to chance it and lose out on my return within 30 days policy, so back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Cadmes

customer_reviews.title: Became a huge headache
customer_reviews.text: Soooooo disappointed so far! This worked amazingly for 5 days before it took a dump. On the phone with tech support for 3 hours, they had me do the steps over and over and transferred me 3 times.... to do the same steps over and over. Then tried to convince me to do the warranty exchange through them and PAY $29.95 for express shipping! Horrible! Per the final tech support when the router attempted to get a firmware update, it didn’t update and caused it to stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Tmayo

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding router for my gig internet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router to replace my older Netgear router. The interface on this XR500 is my favorite feature. Easy to use and manage my 14+ devices on my network. I am a gamer and a cord cutter for tv. The first thing I noticed after the upgrade was the huge increase in wifi strength and range. The router looks amazing. I am proud to display it next to my high end pc. Runs my gig internet perfeco. I can highly recommend this router for any wifi user not just gamers.
customer_reviews.author: Nick and Lea

customer_reviews.title: No complaints yet
customer_reviews.text: It works great. Increased my speed 3x’s what I was getting from my original gateway. I’m using the default xfinity equipment just put it in bridge mode. My Mac however is pulling in 830 hardwired. I get anywhere between 2-300 thru wifi on my phone which also matches the hardwired speed for my windows computer. Might I also add I am using an intel i3 which could be why I’m not pulling what the Mac Pro is pulling.
customer_reviews.author: Ti

customer_reviews.title: Tons of problems for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a little over a year now and had problems almost from the start. Speeds were sometimes being throttled, connection direct to modem was fine but router slowed it down. Wi-fi would randomly drop and other times it would just drop my 5ghz connection. Today it finally died and no longer will allow outgoing internet connection just internal. Pass on this one, not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: J.Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Gaming like a Pro
customer_reviews.text: I am new to Netgear ,however I have yet to be disappointed .This is a great product . It easily supports all the devices I have hooked up to it and the interface is very easy to access and make changes to your personal settings and get it just how you like it so you can game, stream, browse, whatever, comfortably and securely. I bought my router at Best buy and purchased the Geek squad protection plan, but honestly I don't think I will even need it . P.S. my gaming experience such as accuracy on first person shooters has improved a lot since I purchase it.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Bad Wireless Stuttering/Connection issues
customer_reviews.text: Both 2.4 and 5ghz bands have intermittent connection issues, (1-3 seconds in length) that cause connection drops from games / stuttering / halt of streaming video playback. It affects all devices in the home that are connected to the device and has no impact on distance etc. from the router itself. Wired works fine with no stuttering/lag.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Morris

customer_reviews.title: I won’t mentio there name but they had a good concept. Just not enough handle everything in my ...
customer_reviews.text: I am coming back to Netgear after a 2 year hiatus. It hurts that I left. Went to a mesh network because of the promises they had. I won’t mentio there name but they had a good concept. Just not enough handle everything in my household. Upon hooking it up the interface and everything gave me goosebumps. I was excited all over again to have WiFi. This is a superior device and would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: BLACK DYNAMITE

customer_reviews.title: So powerful
customer_reviews.text: Routers do not get much better than this. I get a strong WiFi signal even down the street. It's solved any latency issues I've had gaming and don't get booted out of games at all anymore due to poor connections. I only have a small issue with the app used to manage the router, where I cannot edit the icons or device type of the connected devices. But that's only a minor gripe when compared to the power of this baby.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Chastain

customer_reviews.title: Best router I ever used
customer_reviews.text: After much research, I went with the 500. My current netgear was only 5 years old but unable to support today's heavy streaming loads. This unit was a simple setup, all the right features, and is fast enough to allow multi HD streams as well as keeping low ping gaming at the same time. I was stunned at the speeds. I have a 200mbps internet connection that seemed like a 50 before this router. Wifi signal is solid throughout a large 2 story house. You cannot go wrong with this router.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Not just another “gaming router”. Works as described!!
customer_reviews.text: The XR500 has exceeded all of my expectations. We easily achieved full cone on multi consoles which is huge! Lag and ping have been greatly improved and WiFi signal strength is strong in our whole house. We couldn’t be happier. Best of all it was cake to setup! The DumaOS software is in a league of its own compared to most routers. I know many of you out there see “gaming router” and roll your eyes, please do your homework because this router is not that ;).
customer_reviews.author: Chris + Cassy

customer_reviews.title: XR500 w/ Netduma OS
customer_reviews.text: The definitive entry level into the high end [router] with a little premium for the Netduma OS. This operating system is easily worth more than they charge in my opinion. It is a continually evolving software that has been in active development for the past 4-5 years. This alone ensures the long life span of this router, not to mention its near future proof hardware. It's gaming oriented but can easily be tailored to multi-use processes. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: A.F.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome router for gamers!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the XR 500! The Duma OS is easy to use and for those with little networking background can easily navigate by watching a couple short YouTube videos. I love the ability to schedule when the internet is available for my kids to use during school nights. At first it will require some fine tuning for a novice so be prepared to play around with settings to achieve the desired bandwidth for specified devices. Overall this is an excellent product for the price and the ultimate router for those serious about gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron O. Sharples

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up
customer_reviews.text: While I had a bit of a hiccup doing the firmware update, all in all it set up easily and the improved power is impressive. Works great with the Netgear mesh extenders.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Lueder

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic router!... Except when it freezes
customer_reviews.text: This router is fantastic with great performance and a full set of easy to use network bandwidth management tools! My only problem with it is that it freezes once every two weeks or so and while not much of a problem, I do have to reboot it to fix it when it does. I would give 5 stats otherwise. Fantastic product that I'm extremely happy with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Luke K.

customer_reviews.title: WiFI is Garbage
customer_reviews.text: The WiFi is garbage, I got this to replace an old Belmont AC1200 because it started getting hot and turning off every 2-3days, the Belkin for like $30 smokes this, I pay for 450mbps which they both get about 500mbps hardwired but the WiFi on the Belkin completely BLOWS the NightFlop away, belkin is steady at 160+ on my phone test where the NightHawk struggles to get 50, usually 48 w a spike to 60.... the Belkin is like $140 cheaper and the one I have is about 3 years old. Btw, I bought the XR300
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I was not paid to make this review.
customer_reviews.text: I like the router. It's lightyears ahead of the TP-Link router I was using. Thought I had a bargain with TP Link, but they're trash. NETGEAR can expect me to buy from them again. Wish this thing had a switch to dim or turn off the lights. It lights up the room at night. Guess I don't need that night light anymore.
customer_reviews.author: moemoe

customer_reviews.title: Gave it a chance
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router for more than a year. It sometimes works perfectly but at other times it makes me want to punch a hole in the wall. I need consistency and this is not it. I've been trying to fix this lagging issue I've had for the last few weeks and I can't take it anymore. I used to have an Asus router with no issues but it was really outdated, so I decided to upgrade to this and I think it's time I put her down. Internet drops too much, download speed are not consistent, and little bugs that make it not so impressive for how much money I paid.
customer_reviews.author: xGeRmZz

customer_reviews.title: This thing is WAY better than my old Netgear Nighthawk...
customer_reviews.text: I had an older nighthawk that didnt really reach my entire home with its 5ghz network. The wifi would drop, causing huge issues with my xbox and gaming. I moved it around a bunch but it never seemed to do the job. The new one is fantastic. It works in my house, in the yard, and I have no further issues with the wifi dropping in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well initially, started dropping connections over time
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was pleased with the XR500 router (aside from the overall size of this thing). It seemed to perform well. I wasn't fond of the UI, but I rarely had to deal with it past the initial setup so I could live with that. Around six months in we started noticing slow and even dropped connections. This became worse over time and resetting the unit didn't help. Finally I had enough and reverted back to our old wifi router. It's slower than the XR500, but rock solid at least.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Patton

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR NightHawk XR500
customer_reviews.text: Owned for about 1 week thus far. DumaOS is easy to use and very helpful with information about each feature. All of my devices pick-up the WiFi signal from the router and the connections are strong. Sleek design. Largest router that I've seen. Purchased to use with my Alienware Aurora gaming PC. Still exploring the features. Would recommend thus far.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ferrecchia

customer_reviews.title: I actually didnt like this router its stictly for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other gaming routers that do a great job for gaming and other uses , this is stictly for the gamer, the software revolves around gaming only and though works fine i went back to the ASUS 88U for gaming and all around use
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Armani

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Router for QoS and traffic prioritization per device on Network
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router with the intent to utilize the DumaOS that allows you to prioritize your bandwidth per device. It also has real time Network Utilization which is a plus. Great affordable Gaming router for both managing network traffic and improving performance for gaming. Since configuration and startup, I have not had to reboot this router once in the two months it has been running.
customer_reviews.author: JamieLB

customer_reviews.title: Gaming w/ High speeds
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing I just had a party where 5 PS4 where running at the same time and we played games online all night. There was no lag at all between us. I recommend this product definitely for gaming. While all of this was going on my parents even were streaming a movie. Make sure you adjust settings online for your router so a device doesn't take all the bandwidth available. Awesome product. I am 17 buying this product as a gamer and it works perfectly we went from a crappy router running at 32mbps to an average of 433mbps now we are getting what we payed for.
customer_reviews.author: G  Strat

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: The features sound great, but only if the device can stay up. I am constantly dealing with random reboots! I have reset the device, tried upgrading the bios several times, but nothing fixes the issue. Save your money and sanity, purchase another brand. Also, for the price, your would think they would offer better support. I will never buy another netgear product.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Sets up easily.
customer_reviews.text: We had slowing issues with old router and this really stepped up speed for us. We also wanted better router for security. We don't use the wifi rather have wired in at office. Set up was very easy. The product description talked about improved software and ease of set up and we would agree. Have been very happy the last couple of months with this router in our small office network!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great performance device
customer_reviews.text: Update: I got the replacement today. So far no issues. Wan correctly connects at 1000mb. Wifi performance seems great. DumaOS is awesome. i would give this a 5 start because i think the router is great. but i can only give it 3 at this time because it arrived defective the WAN port only connected at 100MB while it should have connected at 1000MB. Netgear support tried their best, but they merely flowcharted me through things i had already done. I am getting it replaced by Amazon as a return, and if i remember to, i will revisit this review and update. However, i anticipate this being a great router. currenrtly have a Nighthawk R8000 which i have loved.
customer_reviews.author: R. Renzetti

customer_reviews.title: Great Gaming Router!!
customer_reviews.text: This router is hands down bloody amazing! Our internet went from a snail's pace to blown out of the freaking water with this bad boy!! Yiu can control which devices go on which connection. Word to the wise, hook the MOST important items up first, ALWAYS! Otherwise your phones will be getting the higher speeds. You do have to do this every time you want to link something up, but trust me, it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Josie Posie

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!! Packet loss kills gaming
customer_reviews.text: I got this May 2020. Worked great for about three weeks. Then started suffering packet loss on the speed test. I had to do a total reset to get it working again. Lasted about three weeks before it all started again. Did another hard reset. Again only worked for a couple weeks. And in between the hard resets having to constantly do power recycles to get speeds back to normal. Defiantly not worth the $250.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: The DumOS is the best thing to ever happen to wifi! I would recommend watching a few YouTube videos to help you set this up for the best success and to learn about hidden features. For what it’s done, I wouldn’t hesitate spending the $250 again.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. Fails to recognize connection.
customer_reviews.text: Awful started giving me connection problems after 90 days. They sell you a technical service charge after 90 days and they dont even pick up the phone. Ill never buy another netgear product. Update. Ripoff router. Buyer beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Best Router I Have Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: I am a system administrator for a living and so far this is the best router that I have ever owned. I love the DumaOS and how I can customize my dashboard for monitoring, I love being able to see my network traffic easily in one place. The wireless signal is great in my house. My old router would barely reach from one end to the other even on the 2.4Ghz band. This one has no problem broadcasting the 5Ghz band to the other end of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Berk

customer_reviews.title: This router is amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: You will not be disappointed with this router. It's an amazing upgrade even from other gaming routers. The speed is impressive and I get 5ghz at greater distances even the back yard. This one router covers 3000+ SQ foot home and then some. I can't stop talking about how wonderful this router is. I love having the options and customizable settings in the router too!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bookgamer

customer_reviews.title: Seems Great, not the case.
customer_reviews.text: Was a fantastic router, then the problems came. Initially was clean, no issues. Now after an RMA to replace my original, a second XR500 is having the exact same problem of the LAN ports, unexpectedly disabling for no apparent reason. The WiFi stays active, but you have reboot the router to get the LAN ports to come back online. The frequency of the required reboots varies from day to day. The only thing I can figure out at this point is that it's a glitch in their DumaOS. Netgear Support is helping me figure this out, but I wouldn't recommend getting it until they fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfied
customer_reviews.text: I have had many routers in my day, but this one leaves me with a bad taste in my mouth. This product game recommend by a fiend who’s in the tech industry. My first problem came when I can’t run it on the newest firmware, because if I do it reduces my max speeds from 600 to 350. Now, I constantly have to reboot it because the WiFi just won’t work. So my Alexa and other start devices stop working, and I know it’s time to reboot. I must do this every 2/3 days. If I could, I’d return it.
customer_reviews.author: L.C. Lucero

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had luck with a lot of routers that I bought before. I was iffy about this router because my last Netgear modem router combo didn't turn out so great. However, this router worked great from out of the box. The QoS works great. That's what I've been looking for in a router. I can now also track who's hogging the bandwidth and lower their bandwidth or even kick them off the internet if necessary. I recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: T. P.

customer_reviews.title: I am happy to say that the experience so far has been ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this to replace a faulty Tp-Link AC5400. I am happy to say that the experience so far has been fantastic!! I was initially worried about leaving a tri-band router to dual band but the Pro does very well with prioritizing devices and choosing the appropriate network. The setup was so simple I trust even my non tech-savvy parents would’ve had no issues. As with all new products you are ready for small kinks that get ironed out quickly but there are no issues here to report. If you’re looking for a great router with amazing features, you’ve found it!
customer_reviews.author: GretaR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Wireless Solution
customer_reviews.text: NETGEAR logo Now publish your review to Amazon: Your review is already copied to your clipboard. You have been entered into the Amazon gift card drawing, may the odds be ever in your favor. All you need to do is sign into your Amazon account then paste (Ctrl+V) onto the page. Ready? PUBLISH YOUR REVIEW TO AMAZON Perfect Solution By Greg June 12345 Finally bit the bullet and ordered a NetGear XR500 Wireless Router. This thing is the fastest, most solid wireless router I have ever used. I wish I would have bought it years ago to put an end to my wireless streaming and multi platform device issues. Love it, thanks NetGear, keep producing solid equipment such as this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won’t last!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router based on the area of coverage and speed. It didn’t even last 5 months. It was constantly soft resetting. I updated the firmware and it was fine for a couple of days and then went back to resetting every minute or so. So frustrating. NOT WORTH THE MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: mac

customer_reviews.title: Tech Support SUCKS!!
customer_reviews.text: Router was easy enough to hook up. I did have a couple glitches going through setup. Once I had it set up, I experienced an issue with my PS4 regarding chat. I had to call tech support six times and sit waiting on hold for about 3 hrs total, before I was ever connected to some that knew anything about this specific router. Every single person I did speak with was very difficult to understand and even the final person that was supposedly versed on my router, wasn’t very convincing. They passed the buck and said I would need to call PlayStation. I did, did some port forwarding. Problem still exists. Guess I just won’t use private chat.
customer_reviews.author: Denny Putnam

product_meta.title: NETGEAR Nighthawk Pro Gaming XR500 WiFi Router with 4 Ethernet Ports and Wireless speeds up to 2.6 Gbps, AC2600, Optimized for Low ping
product_meta.description: Style:XR500| Size:XR500XR500 Nighthawk Pro Gaming Wi-Fi Router uses state-of-the-art software to optimize your internet connection by stabilizing ping, reducing lag spikes, and keeping you in the game with reliable wired and wireless connectivity for fast-paced gaming. Personalize your gaming dashboard to view real-time bandwidth utilization by device, ping and many other parameters. Limit lag and get a guaranteed local connection with Geo Filter or enable Quality of Service for prioritized gaming devices and allocated bandwidth. VPN Client protects your network identity and prevents DDoS attacks. Blazing-fast 2.6Gbps Wi-Fi speeds, Gigabit Ethernet ports, and a dual core 1.7GHz processor make online and network gaming frustration free.
feature_bullets: Minimize ping and maximize performance with four 1 Gigabit Ethernet ports for lag free, wired connectivity and 1.7 GHz dual core processor network efficiency
Amp up your WiFi with AC2600 dual band router that delivers blazing fast speeds up to 2.6 Gbps
Make every millisecond count by using geo filtering to connect to the closest servers and players so you can respond and dominate
Protect your network identity by connecting to a secure gaming VPN server
Optimized to give you the lowest ping possible on Fortnite, Call of Duty: Black Ops 4, Overwatch, PubG, CS:GO, and more
Put your gaming traffic in a designated express lane with advanced quality of service, bypassing network congestion and reducing lag spikes, jumps and jitters
Monitor your network and game ping in real time so you can see who’s hogging the bandwidth by device and application

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,919 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
